medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a history of hyperglycemia beginning at age 24, with varying degrees noted. Blood glucose levels were reported as 126 mg/dL 11 years prior, 112 mg/dL one year later, and peaked at 217 mg/dL nine years ago, associated with polyuria. After lifestyle modifications, glycemic levels improved temporarily, but she continued to experience elevated blood glucose levels. Pregnancies contributed to fluctuations in her glucose control.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of prediabetes, gestational diabetes in multiple pregnancies, episodes of hypoglycemia during pregnancies, and a diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus made three months postpartum after her second child.
medical_history.family_history: Both grandmothers had type 2 diabetes mellitus. The father had hypertension, was overweight, and was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes at age 50. The mother was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes at age 48. No diabetes history in the two sisters.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with her husband and four children in a suburban community and works as an administrator. Does not smoke, rarely drinks alcohol, and follows a low-carbohydrate diet with regular exercise.
